Re ''Aged, Frail and Denied Care by Their Insurers'' (''Golden Opportunities'' series, front page, March 26):

Long-term care insurance can be a valuable tool for a family's long-term financial planning. It is important that consumers receive recommendations of policies based on their financial objectives. People should receive thorough disclosures and suitable products offered by properly trained and monitored sales professionals.
Companies that maintain programs to monitor all parts of the process -- from marketing to claims -- are more likely to offer products that consumers can count on.
Consumers should ask about a company's corporate commitment to ethical business practices. Qualification by the Insurance Marketplace Standards Association demonstrates just this kind of dedication.
Brian K. Atchinson President, Insurance Marketplace Standards Association Bethesda, Md., March 28, 2007
